alert.note: Alert for Palm Beach (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 27 at 4:04PM EDT until September 28 at 5:00AM EDT by NWS Miami
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of South Florida, including the following counties, Broward and Palm Beach. * WHEN...Until 700 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 400 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated a developing feeder band over the Atlantic waters that will be moving west northwest into the metro areas of Palm Beach County through late this afternoon. These feeder bands will produce another 1 to 2 inches of rainfall on top of the already 2 and 4 inches of rain with isolated areas up to 6 inches that have fallen from previous feeder bands. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. If these rainfall amounts increase more than forecast, then a Flash Flood Warning may be needed for this area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Coral Springs, West Palm Beach, Boca Raton, Deerfield Beach, Boynton Beach, Delray Beach, Wellington, Jupiter, Palm Beach Gardens, Lake Worth, Riviera Beach, Palm Beach, Tequesta, Highland Beach, Juno Beach, Ocean Ridge, Coconut Creek, Greenacres, Royal Palm Beach and Parkland. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
